comments.body: in which cases would this fail to import?

Well, from our point of view I guess it would be a weird case but it was added following Ansible templates/recommendations. It will be a nice controlled exception in the weird case of not having the module being tested. The output message in that case will be much cleaner and simpler for the user.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@try:
    from ansible.modules.network.fortios import fortios_system_resource_limits
except ImportError:
    pytest.skip("Could not load required modules for testing", allow_module_level=True)
